data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_AllowUserControlNotes
data.value: If enabled, users will be given the option to deny receiving emails from the system.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_AllowUsersControl
data.value: Allow Users Control of Receiving Emails?

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_FromAddressNotes
data.value: The address that emails will be sent from. Replies to this address will not be monitored.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_MailHostNotes
data.value: The SMTP host name of your mail server.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_MailServerIntro
data.value: Please leave all the following fields empty if you want to use the default IIS SMTP Virtual Server:

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_PasswordNotes
data.value: If your SMTP server requires authentication, this is your password.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_PortNumberNotes
data.value: The SMTP port number to use. Leave blank to use the default of 25.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_ReplyToAddressNotes
data.value: The Reply-To field that emails sent will contain. Blank will leave header field blank in messages.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_SendInHtmlNotes
data.value: If enabled, emails will be sent out in HTML. Otherwise, plain text.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_String2
data.value: will use the default IIS SMTP Virtual Server to send outgoing email notifications to users in the system. However, it can also be configured to send emails through an external SMTP server directly.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_String3
data.value: This page allows you to change these mail server settings:

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_UserNameNotes
data.value: If your SMTP server requires authentication, this is your username.

data.value: This event will be attached to this artefact type.

data.name: Admin_Notification_ArtifactUsersIntro
data.value: When a selected field is changed, the following users or roles will be notified.

data.name: Admin_Notification_Intro
data.value: The following notification events have been defined for this product. To activate or deactivate an event or change assigned fields or users, click the 'Edit' link.

data.name: Admin_Notification_IsActiveNotes
data.value: Whether this event is active or not.

data.name: Admin_Notification_OnCreationNotes
data.value: Whether this event is fired on a new artefact creation.

data.name: Admin_Notification_SubjectLineNotes
data.value: The subject-line of the e-mail notification. Tokens used in the email template can be used in the subject line.

data.name: Admin_RoleList_Intro
data.value: The following roles have been defined in the system:

data.name: Admin_VersionControlProject_Intro1
data.value: Please edit the following product-specific settings for the

data.name: Admin_VersionControlProject_Intro2
data.value: source code provider. If you leave any fields blank, then the value will be taken from the provider’s default settings. To stop using this provider on the product, just set the Active flag to No below:

data.name: Admin_VersionControlProvider_Intro
data.value: Please enter/edit the following information for the provider. The exact information that needs to be entered is specific to each provider, and you should refer to the documentation for the provider when entering/changing it:

data.name: Admin_VersionControlProvider_Intro2
data.value: The following settings are used for any products that do not define their own settings:

data.name: Admin_VersionControl_Intro
data.value: is able to integrate with a variety of external version control systems using its flexible, open architecture and library of available version control providers.

data.name: Admin_VersionControl_Intro2
data.value: This page allows you to view, add and modify the list of version control providers, make changes to their configuration and also specify any product-specific configuration values:

data.name: GlobalNavigation_SearchTooltip
data.value: You can search by keywords or by entering an artefact unique token (e.g. IN45 for incident 45)

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_PointEffortNotes
data.value: This is the conversion factor used to determine the number of person-hours per estimated point.

data.name: UserProfile_Avatar_Notes
data.value: The Avatar image cannot be more than 100k in size and no larger than 100x100 pixels square. Only JPG, GIF, and PNG image types are allowed. You will need to clear your browser cache to see the new avatar.

data.name: UserProfile_Avatar_UploadNewTooltip
data.value: Select File, then click the Update button below.

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_ReqStatusAutoPlannedLabel
data.value: When you assign a release to a requirement, it changes to the 'Planned' status automatically.

data.name: GeneralSettings_InstantMessengerNotes
data.value: Enables use of the integrated instant messenger.

data.name: GeneralSettings_InstantMessengerRetention
data.value: The number of days that read instant messages are retained in the system.

data.value: test case(s) not associated with this release

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_SendEmailFromUsersNotes
data.value: If enabled, any messages sent using the Email button will appear from the user that initiated the Email, and not the System Administrator.

data.name: Admin_TaraVaultConfig_Intro1
data.value: TaraVault is the hosted source code repository and software configuration management (SCM) system provided by OnShore Technology Group.

data.name: Admin_TaraVault_Confirm_Deactivate
data.value: Once TaraVault is deactivated, you will lose all version control files and user mappings. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: Admin_TaraVault_Confirm_ProjActivate
data.value: Once the product is activated, no changes can be made to its configuration. Are you sure you want to activate this Product?

data.name: Admin_TaraVault_Confirm_ProjDeactivate
data.value: Deactivating this product will remove all source-control files. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: Admin_TaraVault_SelectProject
data.value: You need to select a product to configure product settings.

data.name: Global_ChooseReleaseTypeSettingTooltip
data.value: Determines whether the data is based on the incident's detected release or planned release.

data.name: Admin_User_NoTaraProjects
data.value: User is not assigned to any TaraVault products at this time..

data.value: The local folder used by the web process to store cache data. By default or in error, the folder is {0}

data.name: Admin_TaraVaultConfig_Intro2
data.value: Products in {0} can be enabled in TaraVault for storage of product source code files and revisions. TaraVault is provisioned based on a specific number of active users.

data.name: Admin_TaraVaultConfig_Intro3

data.value: Setting this to 'Yes' turns on the integration with Autom8 WorX manual testing tool
